benchmark_details.name: ONERULER
benchmark_details.overview: ONERULER is a multilingual benchmark designed to evaluate long-context language models across 26 languages, adapting the English-only RULER benchmark and including seven synthetic tasks focused on retrieval and aggregation.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of ONERULER is to evaluate multilingual long-context language models' retrieval and aggregation capabilities.

data.source: Created through a two-step process involving writing English instructions and translating them into 25 additional languages with the help of native speakers.
data.size: 5.2K prompts per task per model across four context lengths and 26 languages
data.annotation: Translation by native speakers with strong English proficiency.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on prompt responses in various languages and contexts.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better model performance on long-context tasks.
methodology.baseline_results: Gemini 1.5 Flash showed the best overall performance across models.
methodology.validation: Cross-validated using diverse languages and model types.

targeted_risks.harm: Models may exhibit bias and performance disparities between high-resource and low-resource languages.
